node.Title: The producer-consumer infrastructure model
node.Description: Infrastructure producers and consumers require very different capabilities from their automation tools. Vendors need to provide a flexible infrastructure as code solution that meets users at their different levels of expertise.

node.Title: Avoiding mass assignment vulnerabilities in Node.js
node.Description: This article will demonstrate a mass assignment vulnerability in a Node.js project, how an attacker can exploit it, and ways to protect a web application against it.

node.Title: Elastic Observability: Built for open technologies like Kubernetes, OpenTelemetry, Prometheus, Istio, and more
Monitor Calico with Datadog
node.Description: Calico is a versatile networking and security solution that features a plugable dataplane architecture. It supports various technologies, including Iptables, eBPF, Host Network Service (HNS for Windows), and Vector Packet Processing (VPP) for containers, virtual machines, and bare-metal workloads. Users can employ Calico’s network security policies to restrict traffic to and from specific clusters handling customer data and to quickly block malicious IP addresses during external attacks.Now, Datadog’s Calico integration gives you granular detail into traffic between Kubernetes resources and other workloads, enabling you to ensure that your network policies are properly filtering traffic via iptables.

node.Title: Securing the web (forward)
node.Description: We expect privacy and security controls to be in place for the web applications we use every day. This means not only the use of basic security encryption, but also proper security for stored data and secure environments for the development and deployment of applications. For all of these controls to be in place, web application developers should be more engaged in security practices.

node.Description: Recent Terraform Enterprise releases include powerful new features such as projects, native OPA support, dynamic provider credentials, and drift detection.

node.Title: Evolving the LinkedIn Business Platform
node.Description: At LinkedIn, one of our most important goals is to offer a top-notch experience for all of our customers. Purchasing is a big part of that customer experience, and it is not as straightforward as many people would think. It can be complex and difficult to navigate, which makes the LinkedIn Business Platform such an important tool for delivering high-quality experiences to LinkedIn sales representatives (our internal consumers) and also customers of our products and services.
